Description: Rectangular plaque (or scaraboid) carved from dark green stone (probably greywacke); slightly convex and plain back; underside inscribed with hieroglyphs, crudely incised; longitudinally pierced.
Curator's comments: Similar plaques in green stone are attested, but they are inscribed with different motto (wishes for a good new near: Petrie 1927, pl. XII, 115) or, more often, bears an inscription linked with the name of gods (Petrie 1927, pl. XII, 110; Hornung and Staehelin 1976, 331, no. 709). Hornung, E. and Staehelin, E. 1976, Skarabäen und andere Siegelamulette aus Basler Sammlungen, Ägyptische Denkmäler in der Schweiz I. Petrie, W.M.F. 1927, Objects of Daily Use, British School of Archaeology in Egypt 42, London.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (OB.04) (phase 3)
